column4: Hi!  What is a good, simple way to do snapshot backups of my ubuntu server?  I want to take daily or on demand snapshots of my main disk (about 5GB) and be able to completely restore back to the state of any snapshot.
what's the most popular? something simple for newbs
I see a whole bunch here:  https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BackupYourSystem
you are right now looking for something that has no newb answer
alright, a couple steps up from a newb
lvm snapshots tend to be expensive
I don't think I would do it every day
I would probably do an xfs snapshot and then back that up
ok, right now i use linode, and they have a great backup manager.  i want to switch to a dedicated setup and wondered if I can get a similar tool that allows on demand or nightly snapshots.
hwilde_ : yes, i want a complete server backup
so then yes, I would use xfs to snapshot and then copy all the files from the snapshot
alright, xfs, i'll check it out.  thanks!
watch out though. If you are running mysql or something, you may want to make sure it syncs disk and locks tables first
yeah, or just shut down the service, do the sync, then bring it back up?
sorry I am just realizing that not everyone has the same uptime requirements I do :-P
hmm, i use postgres on linode, and just do snapshots at 3am during "low" usage...never really considered (nor how to do) sync disk and locking...maybe bad a idea
